文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk1
证据片段: Zirconium alloys exposed to temperatures above 450°C in oxygencontaining atmospheres, will be subject to oxygen diffusion from the oxide layer into the metal.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk1
证据片段: An oxygen-enriched zone is formed having a lower ductility than the metal in the initial stage

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk1
证据片段: The uptake of oxygen by the metal and the thickness of the oxygen-enriched zone were measured as a function of oxidation time and temperature.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk1
证据片段: The use of zirconium alloys in nuclear engineering was initially restricted to water-cooled reactors, that is, to temperatures below 350°C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk1
证据片段: interest also turned to the use of zirconium alloys in CO2-cooled reactors at temperatures above 350 and up to 600°C

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk1
证据片段: The oxidation of zirconium and its alloys at temperatures above about 400°C is characterized not only by the formation of an oxide layer, which is already observed at lower temperatures, but also by the diffusion of oxygen out of the oxide layer into the metal underneath this layer which can dissolve oxygen up to 6.6 weight percent

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk1
证据片段: Tests were conducted on specimens in their initial state, that is, as supplied by the manufacturer, and on specimens with increased oxygen content.

证据片段: The strain-aging behavior of annealed Zircaloy-2 in vacuum was studied as a function of deformation temperature, integrated fast-neutron dose, and degree of cold work.

文献ID: STP458-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_1st Volume_014_chunk4
证据片段: Strain aging occurred in the temperature range 200 to 500°C.
